titleInfo.title: Synthesis, and structural and biological studies of efrapeptin C analogues

mods.abstract: A series of analogues of efrapeptin C (1), with variations in the central tripeptide epitope (positions 6-8), were prepared by a combination of solid- and solution-phase peptide syntheses. The conformations of the modified compounds 2-6 were investigated by circular-dichroism (CD) spectroscopy to differentiate between 3(10)- and alpha-helical secondary structures. The inhibitory activities of the new compounds towards F-1-ATPase from E. coli were determined. The modified congeners 3-5 were less active by one order of magnitude compared to 1 (K-i 10 mu m), and 6 was completely inactive. Our experiments demonstrate that the flexible, central tripeptide epitope, comprising positions 6-8 in 1, is crucial for molecular recognition, even slight sequence modifications being hardly tolerated.
